org.swerverobotics.library.internal

Class AdaFruitBNO055IMU

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.swerverobotics.library.internal.AdaFruitBNO055IMU
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I2cDeviceSynchUser, IBNO055IMU, IOpModeStateTransitionEvents

    public final class AdaFruitBNO055IMU
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBNO055IMU, I2cDeviceSynchUser, IOpModeStateTransitionEvents
    Instances of AdaFruitBNO055IMU provide API access to an AdaFruit Absolute Orientation Sensor that is attached to a Modern Robotics Core Device Interface module.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.swerverobotics.library.interfaces.IBNO055IMU

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Shut down the sensor. This doesn't do anything in the hardware device itself, but rather shuts down any resources (threads, etc) that we use to communicate with it.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IBNO055IMU

      • getSystemStatus

        public byte getSystemStatus()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Returns the current status of the system.
        Specified by:
        getSystemStatus in interface IBNO055IMU
        Returns:
        the current status of the system See section 4.3.58 of the BNO055 specification.
        See Also:
        ResultMeaning
        0idle
        1system error
        2initializing peripherals
        3system initialization
        4executing self-test
        5sensor fusion algorithm running
        6system running without fusion algorithms

      • getSystemError

        public byte getSystemError()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        If IBNO055IMU.getSystemStatus() is 'system error' (1), returns particulars regarding that error. See section 4.3.58 of the BNO055 specification.
        Specified by:
        getSystemError in interface IBNO055IMU
        Returns:
        the current error status
        See Also:
        ResultMeaning
        0no error
        1peripheral initialization error
        2system initialization error
        3self test result failed
        4register map value out of range
        5register map address out of range
        6register map write error
        7BNO low power mode not available for selected operation mode
        8acceleromoeter power mode not available
        9fusion algorithm configuration error
        Asensor configuraton error

      • readCalibrationData

        public byte[] readCalibrationData()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Read calibration data from the IMU which later can be restored with writeCalibrationData(). This might be persistently stored, and reapplied at a later power-on. For greatest utility, full calibration should be achieved before reading the calibration data
        Specified by:
        readCalibrationData in interface IBNO055IMU
        Returns:
        the calibration data
        See Also:
        IBNO055IMU.writeCalibrationData(byte[])

      • getOverallAcceleration

        public Acceleration getOverallAcceleration()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Returns the overall acceleration experienced by the sensor. This is composed of a component due to the movement of the sensor and a component due to the force of gravity.
        Specified by:
        getOverallAcceleration in interface IBNO055IMU
        Returns:

      • getAcceleration

        public Acceleration getAcceleration()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Returns the last observed acceleration of the sensor. Note that this does not communicate with the sensor, but rather returns the most recent value reported to the acceleration integration algorithm.
        Specified by:
        getAcceleration in interface IBNO055IMU

      • startAccelerationIntegration

        public void startAccelerationIntegration(Position initalPosition,
                                Velocity initialVelocity)
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Start (or re-start) a thread that continuously at intervals polls the current linear acceleration of the sensor and integrates it to provide velocity and position information. A default polling interval of 100ms is used.
        Specified by:
        startAccelerationIntegration in interface IBNO055IMU
        Parameters:
        initalPosition - If non-null, the current sensor position is set to this value. If null, the current sensor position is unchanged.
        initialVelocity - If non-null, the current sensor velocity is set to this value. If null, the current sensor velocity is unchanged.
        See Also:
        IBNO055IMU.startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity), IBNO055IMU.getLinearAcceleration()

      • startAccelerationIntegration

        public void startAccelerationIntegration(Position initalPosition,
                                Velocity initialVelocity,
                                int msPollInterval)
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        As in IBNO055IMU.startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity), but provides control over the frequency which which the acceleration is polled.
        Specified by:
        startAccelerationIntegration in interface IBNO055IMU
        Parameters:
        initalPosition - If non-null, the current sensor position is set to this value. If null, the current sensor position is unchanged.
        initialVelocity - If non-null, the current sensor velocity is set to this value. If null, the current sensor velocity is unchanged.
        msPollInterval - the interval to use, in milliseconds, between successive calls to IBNO055IMU.getLinearAcceleration()
        See Also:
        IBNO055IMU.startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity, int)

      • stopAccelerationIntegration

        public void stopAccelerationIntegration()
        Description copied from interface: IBNO055IMU
        Stop the integration thread if it is currently running.
        Specified by:
        stopAccelerationIntegration in interface IBNO055IMU
